lead_paragraph: Saudi-led bombings of medical facilities and schools have caused Doctors Without Borders to scale back its efforts, and have caused Congress to put the Obama administration on notice.

byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti reported from Washington, and Shuaib Almosawa from Sana, Yemen.
byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and SHUAIB ALMOSAWA

headline.print_headline: Deadly Hospital Bombing Highlights an Escalating Conflict in Yemen
headline.main: Support for Saudi Arabia Gives U.S. Direct Role in Yemen Conflict

snippet: Saudi-led bombings of medical facilities and schools have caused Doctors Without Borders to scale back its efforts, and have caused Congress to put the Obama administration on notice....
abstract: Group of lawmakers circulate letter calling on Pres Obama to withdraw request for Congressional approval of $1.5 billion weapons sale to Saudi Arabia until debate over military support for country is heard; reluctance to aid Saudi Arabia comes amid growing concern and anger over Saudi-led bombings of civilian targets in Yemen, which has had backing of United States.
